info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 09 at 2:33PM PDT until April 11 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM SUNDAY TO 5 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of the Highway 97 corridor from south of Modoc Point north through Crescent. This includes Chemult and Chiloquin. * WHEN...From 5 PM Sunday to 5 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong, gusty winds and blowing snow could reduce visibilities to near white out conditions at times. The heaviest snow will occur Sunday night into Monday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
